critique: This document pertains to the establishment and modification of the Career Executive Board within the Civil Service System. It outlines the composition of the board, including the appointment of members by the President and representation from executive agencies. Given the limited scope and focus on internal administrative structure, the document does not directly address issues related to ideological tilt, immigration, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral. The executive power axis is slightly expanded as the president has the power to appoint members.
